document.docAuthor: Ramos, Elizabeth Quisberth, Norrbom, Allen L., Marinoni, Luciane, Sutton, Bruce D., Steck, Gary J. & Sánchez, Juan José Lagrava
document.masterDocTitle: The Bolivian fauna of the genus Anastrepha Schiner (Diptera: Tephritidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Bolivian fauna of the genus Anastrepha Schiner (Diptera: Tephritidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution in Bolivia : Cochabamba (this publication), La Paz ( Hendel 1914 , González et al . 2011,
Conde Blanco et al . 2018
), Santa Cruz (
Ledezma et al . 2013
,
Barr et al . 2017
, this publication), Tarija (
Ovruski et al . 2009
, this publication).

New specimen data:
BOLIVIA : Cochabamba :
Carrasco , Manco Kapac , 17.180389°S 64.579889°W ,
241 m
, McPhail trap 6,
15 Jun 2005
, E. Quisberth , G. Zárate & A. Saldaña , 1♀ ( MNKM )
.

Andrés Ibáñez , Potrerillo del Guendá , entrance road, across river, trail near 2nd gate, 17.67689°S 63.44706°W ,

New host plant data:
Myrciaria floribunda
(H. West ex Willd.) Berg ( Myrtaceae ) and
Pouteria glomerata (Miq.) Radlk.
( Sapotaceae ).

Comments:
Anastrepha fraterculus
is known to be a cryptic species complex; to date, only the Brazil-1 morph has been reported from Bolivia (
Hernández-Ortiz et al . 2015
,
Sutton et al . 2015
).
